<0>
  TL;DR:
  <2>
    We pledge to act and interact in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming,
    diverse, inclusive, and healthy community, and we would like you to do so
    too.
  </2>
</0>
<1>
  This document outlines what we expect from everyone on this site. We as
  members, contributors, and maintainers pledge to make participation in our
  community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body
  size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender
  identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic
  status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, or
  sexual identity and orientation.
</1>
<3>Our Standards</3>
<1>
  Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment for our
  community include:
</1>
<4>
  <5>Demonstrating empathy and kindness toward other people</5>
  <5>Being respectful of differing opinions, viewpoints, and experiences</5>
  <5>Giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback</5>
  <5>
    Accepting responsibility and apologizing to those affected by our mistakes,
    and learning from the experience
  </5>
  <5>
    Focusing on what is best not just for us as individuals, but for the overall
    community
  </5>
</4>
<1>Examples of unacceptable behavior include:</1>
<4>
  <5>
    The use of sexualized language or imagery, and sexual attention or advances
    of any kind
  </5>
  <5>
    Trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, and personal or political
    attacks
  </5>
  <5>Public or private harassment</5>
  <5>
    Publishing othersâ€™ private information, such as a physical or email address,
    without their explicit permission
  </5>
  <5>
    Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a
    professional setting
  </5>
</4>
<3>Our Responsibilities</3>
<1>
  We, as the site's moderation team, are responsible for clarifying and
  enforcing our standards of acceptable behavior and will take appropriate and
  fair corrective action in response to any behavior that they deem
  inappropriate, threatening, offensive, or harmful.
</1>
<1>
  We retain the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject comments and
  content that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, and will communicate
  reasons for moderation decisions when appropriate.
</1>
<3>Enforcement</3>
<1>
  Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be
  reported to the moderators responsible for enforcement on the
  <6>Issues and Suggestions</6> page. All complaints will be
  reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.
</1>
<1>
  Moderators are obligated to respect the privacy and security of the reporter
  of any incident.
</1>
<3>Attribution</3>
<1>
  This Code of Conduct is heavily adapted from the
  <7>Contributor Covenant</7>,
  version 2.1. We've decided to cut it down to what we see fit, but we may
  change this document in the future without prior notice.
</1>
